Dear Ms. Klinski:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 For repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. Failure to submit an acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am unavailable, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the local office at (248) 975-5053.

II. ALLEGATION:

III. METHODOLOGY
02/17/2022 Special Investigation Intake
2022C0108014

Viewed video; interviewed youth and staff; reviewed incident
report; nursing assessment; witness statements

02/24/2022 Pre-exit with Director 1
ALLEGATION:
Staff allegedly punched 18-year-old youth in the face in response to the youth spitting in
his face.
INVESTIGATION:
I viewed video of the incident on-site and Director 1 also provided a hard copy via
flash drive. Prior to the start of the video, Director 1 said Youth D had already
removed his shirt, pulled the sprinkler system in his room causing it to flood and staff
removed all of the other youth off the pod as a precaution. Director 1 explained that
Youth D had a court hearing the day after the incident and “tends to assault people
before court.”
2

Video of Pod 4 on 2/16/22
1:38:31 – Youth D is sitting shirtless in the general area on top of a table. Staff 1 is
standing in a puddle of water looking through the window of Youth D’s room.
Supervisor 2 is exiting the pod, leaving Staff 1 alone with Youth D. As Supervisor 2
exits, Youth D hops off of the tabletop and approaches Staff 1.
1:38:35 – As the exit door closes behind Supervisor 2, Staff 1 approaches the same
exit door with Youth D walking beside him.
1:38:44 to 1:39:17 - Staff 1 and Youth D stand at the exit door talking.
1:39:18 – With Youth D standing beside him, Staff 1 unlocks the door and starts to
exit the pod, which would have left Youth D alone in the general area.
1:39:20 to 1:39:28 Youth D pushes the left side of his body into Staff 1’s right side
and attempts to exit the pod with Staff 1. Supervisor 2 is on the outside of the door.
He pushes the door closed from the outside and remains in the hall. Staff 1 faces
Youth D, grabs his wrists, raises his arms above his head and attempts to restrain
the youth against the wall.
1:39:28 – Supervisor 2 re-enters the pod and attempts to physically intervene by
grabbing at or holding one of Youth D’s wrists for the next 11 seconds while the
altercation continues.
1:39:39 - Supervisor 2 steps back and calls on the radio for assistance while Staff 1
and Youth D continue to tussle, interlocked with one another.
1:39:39 to 1:40:26 – Using his weight and momentum, Staff 1 pushes Youth D
against the wall several times while Supervisor 2 holds Youth D’s right wrist but is
unable to stop the altercation.
1:40:27 – Security Supervisor 3 enters the pod. Staff 1 swings his right fist toward
Youth D’s face and then sends an uppercut with his left fist.
1:40:32 to 1:40:37 Staff 1 steps back while both supervisors huddle around Youth D
trying to protect him. Staff 1 appears to be exiting the pod, but suddenly turns back
and swings again at Youth D while Supervisor 1 extends his arm to block Staff 1.
1:40:37 – Security Supervisor 3 motions for Staff 1 to exit the pod. Staff 1 exits into
the hall but stands in the doorway with the pod door open.
1:40:51 to 1:41:10 – Staff 1 re-enters the pod approaching Youth D who has moved
with the supervisors into the general area. Youth D re-escalates. Supervisor 1 hand
gestures for Staff 1 to halt. Staff 1 disregards the supervisor’s direction, and
3

approaches the youth anyway, appearing to taunt him. Both supervisors struggle to
hold Youth D back from physically re-engaging with Staff 1.
1:41:10 – Security Staff 4 enters the pod. Staff 1 exits the pod door again, this time
closing the door behind himself.
1:41:10 – 1:41:25 – Youth D deescalates and sits back on the top of the table.
Documentation
An incident report by Facility Manager 1 dated 2/16/22 indicates the following:
“While on Pod 4, Youth D became upset and began pacing the pod threatening
staff. As Staff 1 tried to exit the pod through the resident’s pod door, Youth D
assaulted Staff 1 trying to force his way out of the door into the hallway. Security
called for assistance Supervisor 2 arrived on the scene and intervened by
attempting to separate the two unsuccessfully. Youth D resisted attempts and
began to throw punches at Staff 1 and spit in Staff 1’s face. Staff 1 then began to
exchange punches with Youth D before Supervisor 2 and Security Supervisor 3
were able to separate them.
After review of the incident via camera, Staff 1 was immediately released from
his duties and the facility. Director 1 was notified immediately. Youth D’s CMO
worker was contacted at 3:45pm. Youth D was examined by the medical
department for further evaluation. He did not sustain any injuries and chose not
to press charges. Licensing and CPS were contacted. A safety plan is in place
as Staff 1 has been suspended pending the outcome of the investigation.”
A written statement by Staff 1 dated 2/16/22 indicates: “Was walking out of this pod
when Youth D tried to escape. I pinned against the wall. Supervisor 2 stop
restraining and he hit me so I pin him back against the wall and he started spitting.”
A written statement by Security Supervisor 3 dated 2/16/22 indicates:
“Security was called to Pod 4. I immediately ran down to the pod. Once I arrived to
the resident door, I opened it to find Youth D being physically aggressive with staff
on the pod. I intervene removing resident back toward the dayroom and away from
everyone else. From there I work on deescalating Youth D.”
A note by Nurse 1 dated 2/16/22 indicates:
“Called to pod by Facility Manager 1 to see Youth D after some kind of physical
altercation. Resident refused to be seen…Agitated, irritable, dismissing of writer and
care…Refused to be seen by writer.”
Training records indicate Staff 1 attended “Handle with Care” verbal de-escalation
training on 1/21/22 and physical intervention training on 1/22/22.
4

Interviews
I interviewed Youth D, age 18. He said he has been at the facility for 2.5 years.
Speech difficulties were evident. I asked Youth D about the incident with Staff 1. He
admitted he pushed against Staff 1 in an attempt to exit the pod. He did not know
why he wanted to exit. After that, Youth D said he and Staff 1 were grabbing each
other and he was holding onto Staff 1’s shirt. He denied that Staff 1 punched or
swung at him, adding “I’ve got short-term memory loss…I got a head injury when I
was age 2.” Youth D said he had no injuries resulting from the altercation.
According to Director 1, Staff 1 has only worked at the facility for one month. He
was suspended immediately following the incident and his employment will likely be
terminated. I was unable to interview him because the facility was unable to reach
him or leave a message.
I interviewed Supervisor 2 who has worked at the facility for five months. Asked
why he left Staff 1 alone with Youth D just prior to the incident, he said he left
because he assessed that Youth D was “fine.” After exiting, he heard commotion
from the hall. Supervisor 2 looked through the door window and “it looked
aggressive.” “Youth D was being assaultive, reaching at Staff 1. I came in and tried
to separate them at first. Youth D spit toward Staff 1 and on me. It landed on my
neck. Staff 1 was upset. I stood between them. Staff 1 threw a couple punches…I
didn’t see if it connected.”
I interviewed Security Supervisor 3 by phone. He has worked at the facility for five
years. Security Supervisor 3 said he was called to Pod 4. Upon entering, he saw
Youth D “being aggressive” and separated him from Staff 1. Security Supervisor 3
said he did not see Staff 1 punch or swing at Youth D. He denied that Staff 1 was
physically aggressive toward the youth. After Youth D and Staff 1 were separated.
Security Supervisor 3 said Youth D spit in Staff 1’s direction causing Staff 1 to
become “verbally aggressive.” “I asked him to leave. He didn’t leave right away.
He was told again.”
5

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.158 Discipline.
(2) An institution shall prohibit all cruel and severe
discipline, including any of the following:
(a) Any type of corporal punishment inflicted in any
manner.
ANALYSIS: Video footage shows Staff D threw two punches toward Youth
D’s face and chest. After assistance arrived and the two were
physically disengaged, Staff 1 reapproached the youth twice
more, swinging at him a third time and provoking the youth with
his presence.
It could not be determined by the video whether or not Staff 1’s
swings connected with any part of the youth’s body. Youth D
said he did not remember being punched due to short-term
memory loss stemming from a head injury at age 2.
After the incident, Youth D refused to be examined by the nurse,
but denied any injuries resulting from the altercation.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4159 Resident restraint.
(2) Resident restraint shall be performed in a manner that is
safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity of the
minor child’s behavior, chronological and developmental
age, size, gender, physical condition, medical condition,
psychiatric condition, and personal history, including any
history of trauma, and done in a manner consistent with the
resident’s treatment plan.
ANALYSIS: When Youth D pushed his left shoulder against Staff 1’s right
shoulder attempting to exit, Staff 1 grabbed and held the youth’s
arm(s)/wrist(s) above his head against the wall, restricting the
youth’s movement. This is not an approved physical
management technique.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Once an acceptable corrective action plan is received, I recommend this facility
continue its current licensing status.
